briefTitle: Preventing Caries in Preschoolers: Testing a Unique Service Delivery Model in American Indian Head Start Programs
officialTitle: Preventing Caries in Preschoolers: Testing a Unique Service Delivery Model in American Indian Head Start Programs
conditions: Fluoride Varnish and Oral Health Promotion

interventions.name: Dental services delivered by the Indian Health Service.

arms.label: COHS administered fluoride varnish and oral health education

summary: An intensive intervention of specially trained paraprofessionals, called community oral health specialists (COHS), administering on a quarterly basis for 2 years fluoride varnish and oral health promotion education, compared to usual care, will reduce decayed, missing, and filled tooth surface measures at 2 years for children in American Indian Head Start Programs.

primaryOutcome.measure: Evaluation of Decayed, Missing, and Filled Tooth Surfaces (Dmfs) at Baseline

effectByArm.arm: COHS Administered Fluoride Varnish and Oral Health Education
